title: Shop worker, 21, killed herself after finding child abuse on boyfriend’s phone
text:
Lydia Roberts, 21, died by suicide after making the discovery, her inquest heard (Picture: Cavendish)

A young woman took her own life after finding child abuse pictures on her boyfriend’s mobile phone while he was at work.

Lydia Roberts, 21, was said to have felt ‘violated and hurt’ after the discovery on a second phone owned by businessman Adam Wells, 27.

Lydia, a sales assistant at H&M, had been dating Wells for two years when she found the pictures on 9 June, 2017, just hours before her death.

Company director Wells had downloaded the images from a Russian based website. He has since been convicted of possessing indecent photographs of children.

On the day she made the discovery, Lydia began rowing with her boyfriend over text before he returned to their shared flat in Radcliffe, Greater Manchester, on his lunch break.

The row continued as he left the flat, returned to work and later, went on a night out with his colleagues.

When Wells came home at 3.30am the next morning, he found Lydia had taken her own life.

Lydia rowed with her boyfriend over text during the day and took her own life later that night (Picture: Cavendish)

Lydia’s mother said she felt ‘violated, hurt and disgusted’ after finding the pictures (Picture: Cavendish)

An inquest heard she had a previous history of suicide attempts and had been prescribed medication for depression.

Recording a conclusion of suicide by hanging, Coroner Zak Golombeck said: ‘Adam and Lydia had been corresponding by text message during the course of 9 June.

‘Lydia was at home and Adam was at work for a larger period of the day and later out with friends and colleagues.

‘The nature of the messages had been that Lydia and Adam had argued about content found on one of Adam Wells’ mobile phones.

‘Adam Wells had returned home at around lunch time and shortly after him departing, Lydia had continued to message Adam Wells.

‘It continued up until 7pm or shortly thereafter, whereupon no further text messaging or contact was made between Adam and Lydia.’

Wells called 999 after finding Lydia at the flat but she was pronounced dead by paramedics in the early hours of 10 June, 2017.

Lydia’s family are ‘devastated’ by her loss and say they will ‘never forgive’ Wells (Picture: Cavendish)

The coroner said: ‘I have considered the totality of the evidence and I am able to conclude that Lydia Roberts took her own life and intended to do so.

‘To the family, I offer my condolences.’

After Lydia’s death Wells was charged with possessing 31 indecent photographs of children.

At Manchester magistrates court in July 2018 he was sentenced to a 12 month community order, ordered to complete 150 hours of unpaid work and pay an £85 victim surcharge.

He was put on the sex offenders’ register for five years.

In a statement following the inquest, Lydia’s mother Michelle said: ‘Lydia felt violated, hurt and disgusted at what she found – even more so at the thought of Adam being with her young niece and nephew.

‘I feel that he made her make the decision to do what she did.

‘As a family we are devastated at the loss of our beautiful daughter and for this we will never forgive him.

‘In our opinion we are left now with more unanswered questions and hope one day to find out the truth.’
